title: Thai Green Curry with Tempeh
directions: Cook long grain brown rice according to package directions.
In a medium sized Dutch oven, add cubed tempeh, ½ cup water, and ¼ cup tamari.
Bring to a boil, then immediately reduce heat to low and let simmer, covered, for 10 minutes, or until most of the liquid has been absorbed and tempeh is tender.
Remove tempeh with a slotted spoon and set aside.

In the same Dutch oven, heat coconut oil over medium high heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, and ginger and cook, stirring frequently, about 3 minutes, or until onion is translucent and garlic and ginger are fragrant.
Add green curry paste, coconut milk, ¼ cup water, kaffir lime leaves (if using), snap peas, red cabbage, frozen green peas, 1 tablespoon tamari, coconut sugar and cooked tempeh.
Stir to combine, then reduce heat to low. Let simmer, covered, for 10 minutes, or until vegetables are crisp tender and cooked tempeh is heated through.
Remove kaffir lime leaves and discard/compost.
Season curry to taste with sea salt, if necessary.
Serve curry immediately over warm cooked rice.
ingredients: cooked long grain brown rice, for serving
